name: Henrhyd Falls and Nant Llech walk

ai.summary: A scenic 8.8 km moderate hike that links Henrhyd Falls with the Nant Llech route. The trail traverses woodland and river areas, offering a dramatic waterfall as the highlight and varied terrain that suits walkers with a reasonable fitness level.
ai.terrain_summary: Combination of forest tracks, muddy riverbanks, and uneven ground with exposed roots. Expect sections of steps and occasional stream crossings. Surfaces near the falls can be slippery, especially after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go; trails can be muddy and slippery. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, watch for uneven ground and short steep sections, and avoid crossing streams when water levels are high. Carry a map or offline navigation (cell service may be limited) and supervise children.
recommended_gear: Waterproof jacket and an extra layer
Lightweight rain pants or rain cover for your pack
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) is best; winters can be muddy and damp.

seo.title: Henrhyd Falls and Nant Llech Walk – 8.8 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore an 8.8 km moderate hike in the UK, pairing Henrhyd Falls with the Nant Llech route. Enjoy forest trails, river crossings, and a spectacular waterfall.
seo.h1: Henrhyd Falls and Nant Llech Walk (8.8 km, Moderate)
